topics.body:
Here's a bit of news: the dalai lama said that there might not be another dalai lama after him or the next one will not be his next reincarnation but rather a voted on figurehead.

It pissed the fuck out of China's communist party cause they've been trying for years to control buddhism and if there's no next dalai lama then all that effort is for nothing.

I support this move cause of the obvious effects it would have.

topics.body:
Hey guys, just out of curiosity, I've been reading up on some old comics. 
But with that whole thing in regards to having Peter Parker/Spiderman, what the heck was the reason behind him sacrificing his marriage over bringing back his aunt who should technically be pushing around her 70s?

That made little sense in my honest opinion, he lost his past lover, and some other friends, and his uncle, but he can't accept the loss of his aunt? I never really understood that part. 

It felt like they could have moved the plot forwards without him doing that, were they lazy or what?
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
Done with Ryuki.

"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54279fc163687240f49c0000#post_54279fc163687240f49c0000
Linkara ranted about that for quite a bit on his one more day review.
topics.author: 5062d6f17f123b3e16001184

topics.body:
"@trashboat":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5427a084636872326cc30000#post_5427a084636872326cc30000

Oh, so what was the conclusion? Lazy writing or the fact that they wanted to make Spidey anonymous again? 

I'd have liked it if Peter just went and lost it, just became a vengeful guy, or better yet, more darker. I mean have him make that wish and realize that his wife had been pregnant and then lose his child. Or make his life worse by killing off his wife, and turning him into a villain, there were a dozen ways it could have gone.
topics.author: 5046d66d7f123b38980018c6

topics.body:
"@Evident Disaster":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54279fc163687240f49c0000#post_54279fc163687240f49c0000
Basically the editor responsible for that had decided that Peter Parker needed to be single in order to be relatable, so he went about annulling his and MJ's marriage in the dumbest possible way.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5427a2a863687245b52d0100#post_5427a2a863687245b52d0100
By him keeping his secret identity and making a deal with Mephisto.

I want to know what the deal was about.
topics.author: 505696b47f123b37e800effa

topics.body:
"@gasmaskangel":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5427a2a863687245b52d0100#post_5427a2a863687245b52d0100

Oh, wow that seems like pretty lazy writing, if they wanted to annul his marriage they could have done that with a little more finesse that and not some stupid plot to have the Devil involved. Jesus they could have done that so much better. 

I mean he could have had it a bit worse, push him around emotionally and then end up annulling the marriage or have MJ nearly killed and suffer amnesia, or end up in a coma. He just moves on, also reestablishing his secret identity kind of defeated the whole purpose of going out of his way publicly to support the super-human registration act.

Also Iron-Man seemed like a total prick throughout that period, I was amazed that no one bothered to learn the truth of the whole Stamford incident, I mean what the hell happened to Wolverine's effort at getting info from Nitro? Or confronting the head of Damage Control? 

I was certain that they shared that information that the whole thing was a setup and they were now killing each other thanks to corrupt government officials?

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5427a58263687206348f0100#post_5427a58263687206348f0100
You know. The Tibetan Empire has always had a long history of conflict with Imperial China starting with the Han Dynasty. The conflict reached an epitome during the Tang Dynasty. Tibet finally fell to Chinese rule along with Mongolia during the Qing Dynasty. At the fall of the Qing Dynasty, both countries declared independence. The PROC later "reclaimed" Tibet.
